alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 12:10PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Coffee County through 1245 PM CDT... At 1209 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elba, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elba, Fort Rucker, Lee, Pine Level, Java, Mixons Crossroads, Curtis, Carl Folsom A/p, Victoria, Frisco, Danleys Crossroads, Eanon, Lowry Mill, Camp Humming Hills, Wise Mill, Roeton, Tabernacle, Arcus and Woodland Grove Church. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for southeastern Alabama.
